pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: :v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9267359552/job/25493651903)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9267359552/job/25493651309)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9267359552/job/25493651601)

Thanks, this is great!

Please apply the suggestions and then feel free to merge.

It occurs to me that some of the lemmas which I have suggested to omit may be used in subsequent work. In that case they may be worth adding but I'd rather add them later on when they are invoked.

bors d+

Thanks, this is great!

Please apply the suggestions and then feel free to merge.

It occurs to me that some of the lemmas which I have suggested to omit may be used in subsequent work. In that case they may be worth adding but I'd rather add them later on when they are invoked.

bors d+

Nitpick, but I slightly prefer:
```suggestion
    ∃ n : ℕ, n • x = ⁅coroot α, x⁆ := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [lie_smul, smul_comm, chainLength, dif_neg hα, (chainLength_aux α β hα h.1).choose_spec]
```

```suggestion
  · rw [coroot_eq_zero_iff.mpr hα, chainLength, dif_pos hα, hα.eq, chainTopCoeff_zero, map_zero,
      CharP.cast_eq_zero, mul_zero, sub_self, Int.cast_zero]
  obtain ⟨x, hx, x_ne0⟩ := (chainTop α β).exists_ne_zero
  have := chainLength_smul _ _ hx
  rw [lie_eq_smul_of_mem_rootSpace hx, ← sub_eq_zero, ← sub_smul,
    smul_eq_zero_iff_left x_ne0, sub_eq_zero, coe_chainTop', nsmul_eq_mul, Pi.natCast_def,
    Pi.add_apply, Pi.mul_apply, root_apply_coroot hα] at this
  simp only [Int.cast_sub, Int.cast_natCast, Int.cast_mul, Int.cast_ofNat, eq_sub_iff_add_eq',
    this, mul_comm (2 : K)]
```

```suggestion
  simp only [← smul_neg, ne_eq, LieSubmodule.eq_bot_iff, not_forall]
```
Let's move this up so that it is just below `chainBotCoeff_add_chainTopCoeff`

```suggestion
  rw [← chainBotCoeff_add_chainTopCoeff, ← chainBotCoeff_add_chainTopCoeff, add_comm,
    Weight.coe_neg, chainTopCoeff_neg, chainBotCoeff_neg]
```

I don't think I'd bother with these unless they kept coming up
```suggestion
```

The two names here should be very similar to aid discoverability.
```suggestion
lemma apply_coroot_eq_cast' :
```
Possibly the `'` should be on the other one but I don't mind which way it is.

Again I wouldn't bother adding this unless it was repeatedly useful
```suggestion
```
I think this is useful to keep. When we are able to calculate `q = chainBotCoeff α β` and `r = chainTopCoeff α β`, then the finset is defeq to `{-q, -q + 1, ..., r-1, r}`.

IMHO spawning goals during a sequence of rewrites is nasty:
```suggestion
  have : (β' : H → K) = -n • (-α) + β := by rwa [neg_smul, smul_neg, neg_neg]
  rw [chainBotCoeff, chainBotCoeff, ← Weight.coe_neg,
    chainTopCoeff_of_eq_zsmul_add (-α) β hα.neg β' (-n) this, sub_neg_eq_add]
```

```suggestion
characteristic 0 form a root system. We achieve this by studying root chains.
```
Oops. Will fix in #13307

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Lie/Weights): `n` such that `n • α + β` is a weight is consecutive.
